metadata.Title: CVE-2019-18928 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
Cyrus IMAP 2.5.x before 2.5.14 and 3.x before 3.0.12 allows privilegeescalation because an HTTP request may be interpreted in the authenticationcontext of an unrelated previous request that arrived over the sameconnection.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-18928` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cyrus-admin - 3.0.12-1
cyrus-caldav - 3.0.12-1
cyrus-clients - 3.0.12-1
cyrus-common - 3.0.12-1
cyrus-imapd - 3.0.12-1
cyrus-murder - 3.0.12-1
cyrus-nntpd - 3.0.12-1
cyrus-pop3d - 3.0.12-1
cyrus-replication - 3.0.12-1
libcyrus-imap-perl - 3.0.12-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: cyrus-imapd package in esm-apps/focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.0.12-1').
